p: The sediment properties at each site were characterised by poorly sorted (South Cove site C), or very poorly sorted sediment (all other sites) (Table 3; following the classification of [ 24]). This variation in grain size was greatest in Hangar Cove with sorting values of 2.87–3.17 ɸ compared to South Cove 1.03–2.65 ɸ. South Cove site C sediment was predominantly composed of sand. The sediment in Hangar Cove contained a much higher proportion of mud (13.3–19.9%) compared to South Cove (1.1–1.9%; F (1,5) = 55.1, P < 0.01). There were no significant difference in the proportion of gravel (ANOVA; F (1,5) = 0.1, P = 0.81) or sand ( F (1,5) = 1.7, P = 0.26) between the coves.
